article_title: FAA Software Upgrade Fails, Triggering Travel Nightmare
article_text:
U.S. airlines and airports along the East Coast returned to normal, albeit busy, operations on Sunday, a day after problems at a Federal Aviation Administration air-traffic-control center in Virginia led to cancellations of 476 flights.

The FAA said late Sunday that its difficulties on the previous day likely were linked to a recent software upgrade at its high-altitude radar facility in Leesburg, Va. The FAA said in a statement that it has disabled the features added in that upgrade as it investigates further, and added...
